name: Rubicon 1988
description: ‘Among top Cape claret blends, significantly improved by longer, newer barrel aging since ‘86. ‘88 displays delicious raspberry flavours, usual elegance, leaner than previous and also excellent ‘87. Despite vintage nuances, a consistent wine, with finesse and dryish tea-leaf claret austerity in the finish, the oak not obscuring the wine. From the safe and steady hands of an unflashy, experienced winemaker, not out to impress with one-off acrobatics, like overdoses of oak. Generally about 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Merlot, 10-15% Cabernet Franc.’ - Platter’s SA Wine Guide 1992, 4.5☆ The wines will continue to be cellared at the Meerlust vintage cellar until maturity (estimated 2028) or withdrawal. Rubicon is not produced every year. If a vintage is not produced, the NFT will include the next vintage, to total 50 consecutive vintages
